column1: Uncontrolled data used in path expression
column2: Accessing paths influenced by users can allow an attacker to access unexpected resources.
Writing user input directly to a web page allows for a cross-site scripting vulnerability.
column4: Cross-site scripting vulnerability due to a [["user-provided value"|"relative:///main.py:28:26:28:32"]].

column2: Leaking information about an exception, such as messages and stack traces, to an external user can expose implementation details that are useful to an attacker for developing a subsequent exploit.
column4: [["Stack trace information"|"relative:///main.py:25:30:25:30"]] flows to this location and may be exposed to an external user.
